object.field: Insider bent on corruption or destruction
Supernatural bent on corruption or destruction.
Alien bent on domination and plunder
Local authority member wanting to help.
Stop the place inhabitants from raiding outside.
Destroy a supernatural threat inside the place.
Find a particular item for a specific purpose.
Retrieve a stolen item hidden at this place.
Find information needed for a special purpose.
Discover the fate of a previous adventuring party.
Find a NPC who disappeared in the place.
Discover the nature and origin of the place.
Pursue fleeing foes taking refuge at the place.
Clean the place so it can be rebuilt and reoccupied.
Discover why a vilain is interrested in the place.
Win a bet or complete a rite of passsage at this place.
Parley with a villain in the place.
Hide from a threat outside the place.
Find the source of a supernatural phenomenom at the place.
Assess the scope of a natural or supernatural disaster.
Escort an NPC to a destination.
Arrive at a destination without being seen by the villain's forces.
Establish trade with a distant planet.
Protect a caravan travelling to a distant system.
Find a place to establish a colony.
Return home from a distant place.
Obtain information from a reclusive hermit.
Find an object that was lost on the way to a distant system.
Discover the fate of a missing group of explorers.
Assess the size of an approaching army.
Escape the reign of a tyrant.
The party is racing against another one with the same or opposite goal.
The party becomes responsible for the safety of a non combattant NPC.
The players are prohibited from killing the villain, but he has no compunctions about killing them.
The adventurers have a time limit.
The party has received false or erroneous informatiion.
Completing an adventure goal fulfills or prevents the fullfilment of a prophecy.
The party has two goals but can only accomplish one.
Completing the goal secretly helps the villain.
The party must cooperate with a known enemy to achieve the goal.
The characters are under special compulsion to accomplish their goal.
Confrontation of the villain and a group of minions in a bloody battle.
Chasing the villain to finally confront him in his/her refuge.
The actions of the party or the villain result in a cataclysm the party must escape.
The party runs to the villain, thus bringing a master plan to its conclusion, arriving just when this plan is about to be completed.
The villain and several lieutenants perform multiple ritual in close locations. The party must defeat all of them to succeed.
An ally betrays the party as they are about to accomplish their goal.
The villain gets new reinforcements at the last minute, forcing the party to defeat the villain and the newcomers.
Third parties turn against the party as the main villain runs her/his plan or attacks
The structure where the final confontation with the villain takes place starts to collapse during the final assault.
A powerful threat (more potent than the party) destroys the main villain, then turns against the party.
The party must choose between defeating the villain or saving a group of innocent/close NPCs.
The party must discover a secret weakness before being able to defeat the villain.
The party meets the villain on neutral ground and suspect hime/her to be up for something bad.
A figure of authority asks the party to take care of the villain plans.
The party discovers consequences of the villain plans.
A minion of the villain gets too talkative.
The party and the villain need something in common. Whoever will reach the goal first do not count, it will draw attention of the other part anyway.
Another faction needs the party to take care of the villain plans.
The villain or one of his/her minions has committed an outrage that must be punished. This outrage is not directly linked to the villain master plan.
The villain asks for assistance to the party, aware of their skills to accomplish a certain delicate task, but not considering the moral quandary the task could bring to them.
The party has been involved in an outrage towards the villain (e.g killing a minion). That draws his/her attention to them with a strong desire for revenge.
The obvious plan of the villain has positive consequences for factions close to the party. This faction is who bring knowledge of the villain to the party, but only from the bright side.

The villain is genuinely convinced his/her plan is a good action (e.g. executing terrorists, launching an assault on a civilian colony). The party and everybody else hear about him first through this particular deed.
The villain shares his master plan to the party, knowing that it will be too unbelievable to others.
Arrival of a caravan or ship.
Remembrance for soldiers lost in war.
Discover the fate of a missing NPC.
Discover the nature and origins of a strange phenomenom.
Secure the aid of a third party.
Retrieve a stolen item in the villain's possession.
Find a specific item rumored to be in the area.
